document_data.name: Insect Sight
document_data.mainbody: '''''Insect sight''''' was a very rare [[wizard]]'s [[spell]] that granted a creature insect-like all-around eyesight for a limited time.
document_data.Effects:
When the spell was cast, the wizard touched a creature, granting them a sight similar to that of an insect, with an almost full 360 degrees of field of view. This allowed the ensorcelled creature not to be surprised by a sneak attack.

''Insect sight'' required 12 seconds to cast, and its effect lasted for 30 seconds at its weakest, and the spell's duration grew along with the spell-caster's magical prowess.

''Tunnel vision'' was ''insect sight''<nowiki>'s</nowiki> reverse spell, and it reduced a creature's field of vision to 10 degrees. It granted them protection against gaze-based magical attacks and abilities but made them vulnerable to stealing and surprise attacks.
document_data.Components:
The spell required [[verbal]], [[somatic]], and [[material component]]s to be cast. Its material components were [[sunblossom oil]] and the dried remains of ten [[flies]].

To cast ''tunnel vision'', the caster needed to use [[nightflower]] sap and an [[earthworm]].
document_data.History: In the 14{{th}} century [[DR]], ''insect sight'' was recorded in ''[[Prismal's Pocket Library, Vol.IV]]''.{{Cite polyhedron/63/Chemcheaux|26}} until the shop's destruction in the late 14{{th}} century DR.{{Cite polyhedron/105/The Ravens Bluff Trumpeter|32}} At some point, one of Prismal's ''[[spellbook]]'' that contained ''insect sight'' left [[Toril]]. The book's original name was ''[[If They Can Do It, Prismal Can Do It Two]]''; it was filled with Prismal's hand-written notes. It ended up in the hands of several spell dealers on the world of [[Nehwon]] where the city of [[Lankhmar]] was located.
